title: ‘Y'all have definitely vindicated me’: Woman leaves $40 steak hidden in the oven to marinate and gets mad when roomie burns it by accident, internet begs roomie not to pay her back
description: Roommate living is not for the weak. The worst part of not living alone is being on other folks' timing. What do I mean by this? Well, having to abide by the rules of your roommates, no matter how small or outrageous their wishes may seem. Are you the unruly roommate? Or, are you like the user in this story who feels like they're under a constant microscope in their home? You've read about food thieves and roommates with cleaning aversions, but this story takes the STEAK.The story poster explains that she went to turn the oven on in her apartment to cook some food. Lo and behold, her roommate was storing and marinating a steak in the bottom rack of the oven and failed to mention this to her. Instead of understanding, the roommate got irrationally angry but still refused to be paid back (the poster insisted she do so). Now, the internet is convincing her she shouldn't go out of her way to give her roomie the money back because her roomie had no right to be upset at her for her own misstep. Commenters are "forbid[ding]" her from coughing up the cash. What do you think? Scroll to read the entire story.
author: Lana DeGaetano

title: 'I think I'm on a sinking ship here:' Woman lands her dream job, only to find out that everyone in her position has been laid off by budget cuts
description: Everyone remembers being asked as a kid what they wanted to be when they grew up. A firefighter. A ballerina. A veterinarian. When you grow up a little bit, these dreams will probably change, but everyone does have that elusive "dream job:" the one job you could work every day of your life, and it would never feel like work. It's rare that you make it to your dream job, so the dream changes and gets a little smaller. In this case, it's best when you hit the sweet spot of a job: it isn't your whole life, but you enjoy the work you're doing, and you believe it's meaningful work. That's the ideal life we all want to live. We feel comfortable in our means, we do work we're proud of, and we can still live a good life outside of the 9-5.When you secure this position, life feels like Swiss cheese. But, like many things in life, your job can pull the rug out from under you faster than your first paycheck hits your bank account. One woman gets unsavory information about her position at her seemingly perfect job. Should she keep her wits about her and be prepared to look elsewhere, or should she remain hopeful?
author: Baiz Hoen

title: Bride stops wedding on her big day to rescue four stray kittens near the ceremony, she adopts them all on the happiest day of her life
description: Ah, mawwiage. Mawwiage is what brings us togevver, today (this is a Princess Bride reference for all of you clueless as to why we are horribly misspelling 'marriage'). But really though, marriage is a beautiful thing. It's the happiest day of your life, hopefully. It's also a very stressful day. For those of you who are married, you know the craziness that comes on your wedding day. You have a schedule that's packed tighter than a cat in a purrito, there is no margin for error and no time for any distractions.That is, unless, the cat distribution system knocks on your door. Imagine you're getting ready, your hair and makeup are done, you take your two-minute and 30-second break in the schedule to walk around and get some fresh air….and then you hear some meowing. Not just one meow, but four, eight, sixteen meows! Naturally, you investigate. You find four kittens in the venue, so what else can you do except put your wedding on hold and rescue the smol little babies? That's exactly what happened below, so scroll down to watch the whole heartwarming video!
author: Blake Seidel

title: 24 Orange Cat Memes With 0 Brain Cells and 1,000 Silly on the Hooman Humor Meter
description: Are you a pawrent of an orange cat? If you are, on the one hand - you have less to worry about, because you have the cat but minus the brain. So, technically, it's less to worry about, because it's literally less of a thing in the cat. But on the other hand, the fact your orange buddy has yet to obtain the single brain cell all orange cats share creates other things you should worry about. Like the orange cat behavior. And yes, we're 200% sure that if you're an orange cat pawrent you know exactly what sort of behavior we're talking about. The orange kind.For everyone else who does not pawrent an orange feline friend, let us demonstrate it to you with the power of memes. We gathered some cat memes that demonstrate the power of a 0 brain cell orange cat to create silly chaos all around them. But it's not just the chaos, it's the… orangeness. And it's definitely great for meme material. It's no wonder this genre of cat memes is flourishing.
author: Ayala Sorotsky

title: Dirty One
description: New Trek has its ups and downs. Statistically speaking, I think downs predominate. I absolutely loved the second season of Discovery, and either liked or couldn't understand why they had done the rest of it. Picard was… man. Lower Decks (Lower Decks!) is legit, and Strange New Worlds balls out of control. Out of control.

title: Long Live Bone Crawford
description: (Sorry I’ve been MIA. This week has been really hard. Sending love to anyone struggling.) Last week we got a letter from our HOA chiding us that our Halloween decorations should have been removed in November, and that we would be fined if we didn’t remedy the 12-foot skeleton on our porch by today. SoContinue reading "Long Live Bone Crawford"
author: thebloggess

title: Error'd: Office Politics
description: "Math is hard, especially timely math," explains The Beast in Black.   Cinephile Jono enjoys contemporary dramas far more than sci-fi. "Letterboxd tells me I've logged this movie 3 times, I'm not sure I'll be watching it in 2566." I hope you are, Jono.   Pieter may have to turn in his official pedants card. Pieter is concerned about the apparent contradiction between the two salaries on offer here, declaring: "The title says She can earn up to 8.000 euro/month. But by the time you get to the actual article link, that amount deflated to 6.000 euro/month. I didn't know it was that bad in the euro zone! Or is it good, since we've got inflation under control? I don't know which way is up anymore..."Pieter, 6,000 is "up to" 8,000. Technically.   Cross-country runner Andrei looks to be taking the long way around for this trip. Says he, "According to Google Maps, one of my transfers involves teleporting about 70 km away to catch my next train."   Finally David B. reports "My wife works as a quality auditor for Initech [ed: the William Lumberg company, presumably, not the Flavor and Fragrance company]. When setting up contact information for a company she will be auditing in the near future they needed some basic information. So much for gender equality." They're just getting ahead of the next batch of executive orders.   [Advertisement] Plan Your .NET 9 Migration with ConfidenceYour journey to .NET 9 is more than just one decision.Avoid migration migraines with the advice in this free guide. title: Study Finds Peeing Contagious In Chimpanzees
description: A study published in the journal Current Biology found that when one chimpanzee urinates, the others in a group are more likely to follow, a phenomenon called “contagious urination” that could have deep evolutionary roots in humans as well. What do you think? The post Study Finds Peeing Contagious In Chimpanzees appeared first on The Onion.
author: The Onion Staff
